title: Opening and awards ceremony
segmentation: Hello everyone, I am a mechanic.
Brazilians let me welcome you in Athens for this conference.

Before I present the statistics that we extracted from the submitted papers and the accepted papers, I'd like to from my side welcome you to Athens and as you all know Athens is very historical place.
It is the birthplace of democracy which is the cornerstone of the Western civilization.
Several other concepts.
Very important for the Western civilization like theater philosophy, aesthetics.
So many have been born in this land, so we welcome you in this land full of history.
But Athens has not only history has present and we hope it will have a bright future as well.
Although we are going through some difficult periods now, I just remind you in 2004 we organized a very successful Olympiad and the Olympic installations are still here.
And you can visit them easily.
So I just wanted to address Athens as the location of this conference.

So now we worked a little bit with submissions with the accepted papers and geographic location of the accepted and and submitted papers, and we had some results that we would like to briefly report to you.
We will not go into details, apparently.
Because there is no time for that, we will put them online somewhere and you are welcome to study them.
So we see that for instance.
Traditional, so this is the semantic distribution of the submitted paper according to the subject areas that were defined, and so we see traditional.
Themes like classification, clustering, reinforcement learning, having a lot.
Feel a lot of submissions, even topics quite traditional, like frequent items etc.
And of course we have new issues like social networks etc.
So this is with submitted papers, semantic distribution and then.
Um?
We have the accepted papers semantic distribution, which is of course the themes are not identical because some papers belong to more than one areas, but we see for instance that classification.
There's again the 1st place and we see that we have many papers selected from relatively new areas like social networks etc.
Um?
Then we tried to.
Make the exercise.
Like finding the selectivity per subject area, and it seems that some areas are relatively easy to give an accepted paper like.
Generative models, whereas others like web mining, text mining etc.
Data so we have a range of selectivity between 65% down to less than one out of 10, so this could it could be used as a guide of future research.
If you wait if you.

Um, on the other hand, we we we, attempted a geographical distribution of the of the of the accepted papers based on the majority of the authors, because sometimes we have papers with mixed nationalities or mixed affiliations.
In the USA really his leading, even the European Conference on Machine learning with regards to the number of accepted papers, Germany has also very strong presence France.
Japan, UK as well and we see that we have papers from all over the world.
We have UN papers from from Iran etc.
So we are pretty happy with the distribution of the papers.
This can also give some intuition on what is the success of the research in its country.
Of course it has to be normalized by the size of the country and research system etc so.
This is what I had to say.
I will now pass the floor to limit Richman opulus that will present the awards to the best papers.
Thank you very much.
Welcome to Athens and have a nice conference and stay.
Thank you.
